survey.question: How much did you enjoy the task?
How difficult was it to communicate with your partner?
How successful do you think you were at completing the task?
How difficult was it to understand your partner's instructions?
How likely is your partner to be a fluent speaker of English?
How likely is your partner to be a fluent speaker of Spanish?
How likely do you think it is that your partner is bilingual?
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: friendly
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: smart
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: collaborative
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: honest
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: funny
How likely do you think it was that you were talking to a chatbot rather than a human?
If you were communicating with a chat bot, would you want them to communicate in both English and Spanish?

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to go?
yes
cool! so, i'm at the starting point now
there's a path on my left that leads to a small island with a tiger. where to next?
north
just to make sure, going north from the starting point would put me off the map
should we try another direction?
west
got it! i turn left and i see a small island with a tiger on it
now where?
right
ok, i'm moving right, southeast of the tiger
there's a small island with a butterfly on it. what's next?
south
good call! going south, there's a big island with a parrot sitting on a tree
where to now?
east
got it! going east and i stumbled upon 3 rocks and a new island with a frog
i'm all ears for the next move
south
i'm heading south and see a crocodile, this is getting wild! where next?
east
moving east, back to the big island and hello again, mr
elephant! what's next, amigo?
north
north it is, and now i'm chilling with a giraffe
what's the plan now?
right
headed east, i'm now hanging out with a snake
what's the next move?
west
oh, we're back with our tall friend, the giraffe! where to next?
south
headed south
hey, isn't that the same elephant again? where to next?
down
sorry, going down would take me off the map
can we try another direction?
south
i'm at the lower edge of the island
don't want to get lost at sea though, which way?

chat.msg: hi there! que comience el juego!!
hello
great, let's begin! first, stroll a few steps westward, right under that wooden bench
head towards the florist stand, but stop right before you reach it
okay
now, twist a complete 180 degrees to your left, cross the trail yet again and walk back towards that white dog
let's do some backtracking!
done
perfecto! now we're going to go south
see another white dog? it's sitting next to a cool picnic setup. head that way!
im here
great job! now, go west, stepping over the mat
don't forget to touch the berries as you go by!
done
brilliant! now, continue westward until you hit another wooden branch
we're crossing that river again, but this time we're heading north. ready?
done
amazing! remember, we're avoiding that green bush up ahead. circle it from the right side
then, we're heading to the florist stand. onwards!
i am here
fantástico! now, turn left and head under the stand
see the bridge with two cyclists? that's our next spot. keep going!
im here
awesome! just past the bridge, you should see two elderly folks on a bench
can you see them?
yes
cool! now, head south just a few steps, between them and another wooden branch
done
ace! you should be by a green bush now, right at the end of the wooden branch
can you see it?
yes
fantastic! now, move east, but stay between the branch and the bush, okay?

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to play?
yes
cool! i'm at the tent at the north of the map
where to?
south towards the dog
there we go! by the dog now
fire on the right, red mushroom on the left. where to now, bud?
to the fire
burning bright! made it to the fire
what's next, pal?
make a right, where you see a blue car
bingo! here at the blue car
which way now?
south, to the tripod stand
check! at the telescope now, which way to go?
left, to the brown house
cool! at the house! *finished* my friend
what a fun adventure, loved your instructions!

chat.msg: hi there! que comience el juego!!
hello
awesome! let's get this adventure started. please head south-west under the first palm tree near you
then take a right to cross the second tree before making a quick left turn before the third tree. continue straight southwards
done
great work! now, see that cute brown puppy over there? go a bit on its left side, then turn slightly left and then towards the south again
keep it up!
done
excellent! now head straight between the big rock on your west and the smaller one on your east
you're heading straight for the water, matey!
done
good job! time to get a little wet. step into the water and you'll see a big red crab
turn right and keep the big rock on your side. continue westwards in the water
done
doing great! next, go along the medium rock you'll see ahead
you'll come across a shark in the water. don't panic, just take a sharp turn right
im at the medium rock
perfect! let's get you back to dry land now
head between the medium rock and a multi-colored ball and then continue north
im north now
great going! now veer a little to the left and head towards the north-west
you'll see a red tent on your left and a big speaker on your right
im there
excellent! now, let's circle around that red tent in an arc shape
done
awesome! now, head south towards the edge of the water

When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
